How many of you can say you never played emulated games growing up...be it console, arcade, PC, etc...guess what...that was because of people working to preserve the games & their systems. FPGA tech has given us a more accessible way to preserve the hardware now too.

If your main argument against preservation is to say that  "[X] isn't preservation!"...but can't actually explain what preservation is...you should probably shut the fuck up about it. Preservation is to PRESERVE things for future use & future generations. Learn before you talk.

Just because you don't feel something is worth preservation doesn't actually change that something should be preserved...it just says you think only what YOU want is important. That's some seriously single minded & selfish ideals like only your tastes matter somehow. #RETROGAMING

I'm seeing arguments against people not pirating games on #WiiU & #3DS because "we can just buy them now!" Congrats...you understand the PRESENT tense...but have completely ignored the FUTURE tense where all of the future gamers exist. #Preservation isn't for you...it's for THEM.

I wasn't the biggest #PS3 fan, but it had a few games I absolutely loved to play. One of the best I wish would get a modern port (PS5/Switch please) would have to be #3DDotGameHeroes. It was a fun take on #Zelda 1 from @fromsoftware_pr & @Altus_West. https://t.co/dI0DULPOvj

Good lord, so it looks like we might have FIVE people on the podcast this week...so...this will be interesting! Recording Friday & goes live Saturday on https://t.co/syhxtEDVns for video & https://t.co/tlCJ8YAplR, iTunes, or wherever you get your podcasts for audio!

I still think #StreetFighterIV is one of the best they made...& this original opening is still fun to watch even today. Any other fans of this game or even specific versions of it? (I've had a blast with them all but this opening sticks with me) :D https://t.co/riwRwwrVuP

@ezknight Hadn't thought about it like that...but...yeah. And as you guess the words you see what letters are there & if they are in the correct position or not. It's surprisingly fun as a good simple puzzle should be.

@CarolPinchefsky I know it's pointless frustrations on my part & I let it get to my head...but it gets annoying to try & engage in conversation to be met with total silence. I promise...I am actually a happy person most of the time lol. Brain is just going 100mph today on a number of things.
@KintaruFusion Yeah...that was truly a weird one.

So I'm seeing a rumor that #12Switch might be getting a sequel? I'm super on the side of finding that to be an awesome prospect. Yeah, it SUCKED if you played it alone, but if you played with a group...it could be hilarious! It was a fun way to show off the Switch features too!

Setup some of my #StarTrek stuff this weekend as I moved shelves around to work on the game rooms. (Little bit of #battlestargalactica from my brother & a sneaky #Futurama ship hiding in there) No where near the whole collection but still fun to share! #DS9 #TNG #Enterprise https://t.co/KGt13Zq3Ju
Is anything worth saying if no one will see it?

Side note...I know I've been asking people for ways to up my listeners for the #podcast & followers on Twitter...that DOESN'T mean I don't appreciate the ones I already have! You do things for others to enjoy...it's not wrong to want to grow that. That's a weird way to critique.

I guess I just want to see how others have their gaming lives affected by their #ADHD from what they play, how they play, & what they do with that love outside of the gaming itself to stay engaged around our #Neurodivergent minds & habits. For the love of the games. 15/15

People don't realize how much their actions & words can DRASTICALLY change how something is enjoyed by others without thinking. They assume people will just "get over it" or "don't be dramatic" without a thought of how that person's BRAIN works differently. 14/15

I had a bad public experience playing a game on Twitch & the fallout was so bad I have yet to bring myself to even turn a game back on that I loved & have only streamed a handful of times since (only because I had friends urging me on). 13/15

Another way my #ADHD changes how I play things is also what happens when negative events happen around something. Take my streaming for example...it was something I LOVED doing...it was another way to chat with other plays & get some laughs. Until one day it wasn't. 12/15

To have those conversations not only to share my thoughts & feelings about the world of gaming but to hear other views/ideas & to know others love this stuff as I do. I get such a rush of happiness doing the show that it drives me to keep it going more now than ever. 11/15

My other part of that is the #podcast I started so many years ago (& have gratefully found a small but loving audience for & surrounded myself with awesome people who enjoy helping me create this outlet). Part of my enjoyment is TALKING to others about gaming. 10/15

I find pleasure in the hunting of a title for that rush of finding something new to try or a "holy grail" item. And I've looked for alternative ways to engage this collection to share it & get even more enjoyment out of it...like my "Moving Foreword" #YouTube series lol. 9/15

But this also wanders into part of why I enjoy game collecting so much. I do play the games I get when I can, but I find myself randomly hopping from title to title as I look for something to "hook" me...to give me that needed boost be it new or old. 8/15

I get that the point is to be difficult...but I don't get why people feel the need to mock or push back on anyone not having the same enjoyment they are about it? I already have an issue keeping my brain "engaged" so why would I endure a difficult game AND fan base about it? 7/15

The arguments fail to admit that others function differently than they do. That means some games they love might just be not that enjoyable for some of us. #DarkSouls is a big example...I have tried LITERALLY every...single...version but run into that frustration wall. 6/15

And that is a lot to deal with. Those jumps in difficulty, for little to no reason, just kill games for me. And I wonder if I am not alone with this in the world of #ADHD #gamers? Of course this also falls into those stupid arguments of "real gamers" that get thrown about. 5/15

Take #PokemonLegendsArceus for example...I have poured TONS of time into this...loving every moment of it...until I didn't. I hit the boss fight with Electrode & it went from fun to frustrating. The rush was gone...I no longer really have a want to play the game now. 4/15

And I realized that the moment a game goes from "fun" to "frustrating"...I immediately lose interest in it. It's no longer fueling what I now know as my "dopamine search" & becomes something I have to force myself to continue & with a library of other games...why would I? 3/15
Over the years I have always had trouble finishing games but sometimes I would burn straight through a title like it was nothing & always wondered why I could for some games but not others. 2/15

As I have been learning how I do things based on my #ADHD, I have specifically been looking at my gaming habits, how games are designed affect me, & my love of game collecting. I've noticed a few things & would love to start a little thread about them...so here I go. 1/15

Be it the Zenspath 4 Button Podcast, the blog, assorted YouTube content, & more...we do it all for the love of it & for people to enjoy & share with each other. To make people laugh & discuss & do what we can to share some happiness around in a sometimes shitty world.

For those that ARE listening to the show or watching the content...every single download & every single view...is HUGELY appreciated! Even when the number just goes up by one, it brings a smile to my face & a hope that someone has enjoyed something we worked on for all of you. <3

No worry to anyone that enjoys the podcast...that isn't going anywhere lol. And I am working on new videos for the Moving Foreword series as well...just needing a short break to re-record old content & build up new stuff too. Just looking at numbers this morning & feeling down.

I do have to admit that the 3 I chose to do the podcast with have been amazing at all of us keeping the others motivated & together. We have all felt down...but we have all helped as well. I'm grateful for that with @KevinFlevin89, @monotonegent. & @pizzadinosaur being awesome.

The other hard part is dealing with the fact you will get 99% more negative feedback (why are you doing this...OTHERS have probably already done it / there are already enough shows out there / etc.) because people love to complain but very little will stop to encourage.

Some of the hardest parts of working on projects is trying to keep motivated to continue when it feels like (& the numbers look like) almost no one is looking/listening/engaging. Everyone keeps telling me to just "keep doing it & they will come" but it doesn't make it any easier.

@Voultar I had a coworker from England get onto me when I answered "yes ma'am" or "no ma'am" as it was seen by her as impolite...but I tried to explain that to me...it WAS the polite thing (& she was visiting Florida...so I wasn't going to be the only one). Was a weird culture clash.

It's the realization that for game preservation, mods (both software & hardware ones) are necessary to keep systems up to date with display technology, add in needed features, or to simply just RUN in the first place! Looking forward to my next Boxy Pixel GBA SP project soon!

From simple updates like capacitors, screen replacements, entire rebuilds, RGB video output, drive emulators, etc. And with the most recent moves from Sony in regards to the PS3, PSP, & Vita as well as Wii Ware by Nintendo before it, I have been doing software mods too.

Growing up, I used to be ADAMENT that a console had to be stock...no mods! But after years of learning electronics & getting more serious about game conservation, it has become apparent this an unreasonable belief in the long term. So now I have been modding a TON of stuff!

@CarolPinchefsky I am grateful, and grateful for the people I am lucky enough to have around me...but sometimes my brain pokes back & its difficult.

I've already had one of my closest lifelong friends tell me that while what I was doing was "interesting" but all together pointless. He was sure others probably already did it, they probably did it better, & most people wouldn't have a use for it. It's a fight to keep going.

I just feel guilty for being excited for something. Like I should just keep it to myself because it's either going to bother people, be a pointless exercise, or be something others have probably already done & I'm just wasting others & my time & resources.

Fellow creative types - Ever work on something...just get SUPER excited...& put everything into it. But when you find people aren't enjoying it or think you're doing it wrong...you just get depressed & just...stop? Lose all confidence in what you're doing & why?
